Articles.Content:
Some follow-up notes:

1) PVG shows warning when you select inclination that is lower than launch site's. Just ignore it, rocket will fly normally.

2) If you use a mod that adds boiloff to cryofuels (like BDB and CryoTanks), note that some upper stages won't be able to endure full flight, notably BDB Centaur D. In this case, use non-cryogenic apogee kick stage or satellite's own engines.

3) Using solid motors is perfectly viable and quite fun. BDB has quite a selection of those. Limit thrust to achieve a low TWR (0.3 - 0.5, or even lower) - this would help to control burn. BDB SRMs can be turned off - use it. Be sure to include secondary RCS engines for fine tuning (BDB IUS has these built-in, and there is a Burner kit available for Star series).

4) Decouplers can and will screw your final orbit, so limit their force.

Hi community.
I don't know whether this kind of material has already been shared, if yes ignore this post.

KSP KSRSS 2.5 - Orbit Builder Tool for Constellations [ENG]
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1vjTgcUdSsk4i8RAypxrY-XDOIsLuUQUGFyrFRidlqEI/edit?usp=sharing

With this GSheet you are able to build a constellation of X satellites. It has been adapted from an existing file for Stock KSP.

Hi again, new separate thing.   I installed sigma binary, which you don't see above, and as far as I can tell Charon still orbits Pluto.    I looked at the file and Charon has a binary section at the top but not Pluto, is that expected?

Hi again again.  Same mods but with Sigma Binary and Kopernicus expansion.     Also Parallax.    I don't seem to be getting any foot prints on any of the moons or bodys.   Parallax also doesn't seem to be giving off beautiful reflections.  I went to Pluto which seemed like a prime canidite for reflections but when I looked down I was disappointed because instead of something like this:

 

I got this (Which is still good it just doesn't look as amazing):

 

Spoiler

 

 

So in summary, I seem to be having some problems with my install.    Foot prints are missing on the moon and most other places.    I think the moon should definitely have foot prints but for me it doesn't.  Any one know how I could fix them?   

New game data folder:  

Edited March 20, 2022 by Tundra

I'm using KSRSS with Sigma Dimensions for the 2.5x scale along with the latest version of Scatterer, EVE, Kopernicus, Planetshine, DOE, and Parallax and I'm getting a flat pink texture on the moon when Parallax is installed. I have seen some past posts in this thread and in the Parallax thread with no real resolution to the issue. Has anyone experienced this lately and if so could you point out steps to resolve the issue. I suspect it has something to do with the textures bundled withe KSRSS but I'm not sure.

1 hour ago, Redleg1 said:

along with the latest version of Scatterer

try 0.772 instead. KSRSS has not been updated to work with the latest scatterer.

9 hours ago, Redleg1 said:

flat pink texture on the moon when Parallax is installed. I have seen some past posts in this thread and in the Parallax thread with no real resolution to the issue.

KSRSS is NOT compatible with parallax , They're still working on an update to make KSRSS compatible with parallax , Just delete it and you're ready to go .

Parallax support isn't complete AFAIK.  There appear to be some textures missing.

Also as orbital says above, you need older version of kopernicus

I noticed that footprints from kop expanded work when you do a fresh reload but not after changing flight scene

Currently playing 2.5x scale. In Hellas Planitia you can go below zero altitude at datum and the ground goes invisible

45 minutes ago, Arthurism said:

Everytime I open KSP it just throws me this error:

This will be some sort of install issue. Without knowing what/how you have things installed, I'll take a wild guess. KSRSS comes in a zip file called KSRSS-megapack.zip. Inside the zip you'll find a folder called KSRSS, it's that folder that needs to be copied into the GameData folder, such that you end up with GameData\KSRSS. If that's how you already have it, then you might need to post a picture of your GameData folder, or your complete log file, as those would give more info.

50 minutes ago, OrbitalManeuvers said:

If that's how you already have it, then you might need to post a picture of your GameData folder, or your complete log file, as those would give more info.

KSP.log:

GameData:

Ah ok - well, there's one problem for sure, fingers crossed that fixing it also fixes the Kopernicus error. Anyway, you're missing SpaceTuxLibrary, which is a dependency of Janitor's Closet.

https://spacedock.info/mod/2210/SpaceTux Library

Leaving town in a minute for a few days, so if this doesn't fix it, hopefully someone else can help!
